gH8b0EqYW1dFCUvOhA-_HQ.text: We ate there twice and both times the food and service were quite good.  Next time we're in the Paddington area we're sure to go back.

Hn07u8V1CHrWHIvR3o042g.text: easily the best sandwich for £3.5.  i'm a creature of habit and stick with the chicken shwarma.and they're nice to jelli bean.  we love anyone who is nice to jelli bean.

sx-lc0mB2r4ucZ1MdYNVQA.text: I honestly don't think I've ever had to wait as long for a falafel kebab. I popped in hoping to get something quick to take away before I got a train from Paddington. 20 minutes later I was still waiting for my kebab and came close to missing my train. There's just no sense of urgency. I also saw a salad I ordered get prepared on a plate, then packaged for take away before being returned to the plate and served to another customer. Not Impressed!

FTE8Ht23vwnCA3YIjv_mGQ.text: The best Lebanese food this American has ever had! Very reasonably priced and the food was just amazing. Service was very kind and friendly. HB and I had the hommus with lamb meat and the special tea. Perfect!

wJndKtddzIXDlLCNi0urxA.text: We were really confused: we tried to find the restaurant Levantine but then found out that this has transformed into Ya Hala. You can still see the old tiling when you use the bathroom. The atmosphere is rather sterile but the food is great! We had five mezze (Hummus Beiruti, Baba Ghanouj, Kibbeh, Falafel and Halloumi) together with their special tee (green-tea, mint and spices) and we were really happy. If you go via Paddington, then this is a great place for a quick, tasty lunch.

Q7SBMW4FpCKUeF3OB1xYYA.text: I got to sample the Shish Taouk and the Chicken Shawarma, and they were both very good.  I hope to eat here again the next time I visit London.

mbFvIGEub73Tp1D6a80YgA.text: Bargain for the price seriously. The price is ok, of course the quality is not amazing but still good and the portion was pretty big and I will not complain :)Service was ok, the girl started to work there just few days before so she was still new and a bit nervous but she's really nice.

g_6JOacOBpp_2tjrD8rOAQ.text: I would totally recommend this place. I just sat down and enjoyed the 'mix fried vegetable' wrap. It was fresh and tasty.Food is well priced, staff are super friendly and the venue is clean and well presented.I  lebanese!

qJdw06u6xSeBEDN3UgQnzg.text: This is a great lebanese restaurant in Paddington. There are so many around that area that it can be a little daunting when choosing one!Working close by means I fancy Middle Eastern food for lunch every now and then, and, having tried a few in the area, I think this is the best one.Everything is freshly cooked/grilled in front of you, they have all the lovely pickles and sauces that you would expect from an authentic Lebanese place and it's not too pricey either.  The freshly squeezed juices are fab and the decor is pleasant. Note: It gets busy at lunch time & they have a min card order of £5.Very close to the main station.

X5RNhUogXcZbUYhdtSGhaw.text: Ya Hala! Amen! I came off an extremely delayed train from London Paddington and was famished. I thought to myself 'I'll literally go to the first place I clap my eyes on' OK so I ignored Angus steak house and then burger king, but you know what they say?!! Third time lucky. I had halloumi to start with and the portion was so big I couldn't finish it ( would be much more suited to a couple sharing) but was delicious. Itthen had a spicy lamb dish with rice and salad! Wow! So good! Then with the bill they gave me a baklava which is like my favourite thing ever. For someone so hungry I left so so happy

vrPMOJDXmXnRpvC10n6zGA.text: This place is great spot for Middle Eastern cuisine. I ordered the Shish Taouk entree with comes with rice and salad. This is one of my usual dishes of choice when dining here. The garlic sauce for the chicken has been different in each one of these places I go but nevertheless its fresh and tasty. The quantity is more than fair for the price and definitely recommend this dish for both those well-versed in this type of food and those who are trying this spot for the first time. You won't be disappointed!

AK_pfk96A_t0yYqIz8DlDA.text: Had terrible service here.  The gentleman that was serving me was laughing with his co-worker and speaking in Arabic while looking at me like "why are you here?"  I'm Filipino so I assume that is the reason why.  His co-worker didn't even laugh, which made it more awkward.  I've been all over northern Africa, the middle east, Malaysia, Indonesia and Marseille and I usually get exceptionally good service from Arab people as it is part of their culture to be hospitable.  I grew up around many Persians so I know this first hand.  I think this guy was just an aberration but he was definitely a socially awkward, weird dude.

k7FzQGqXRZ0bvvMp2-b8TA.text: Excellent place to dine.  The lamb shawarma was one of the best I've ever eaten.   Our family loved every dish ordered and the apple tea is a must have.  Overall a great experience.

7HEXe9PpNkL-919jjokaSA.text: A solid little restaurant right near Paddington Station. Has a nice array of meal options. The food was very tasty and well-priced. We had some hummus and falafel appetizers. I had a marinated chicken wrap, which was very good. The whole meal came out to about 30 squids, so 10 apiece for a flavorful meal isn't bad. Service wasn't super speedy but it was pleasant and fast enough that I wasn't really bothered.I live in the area but seldom eat out around here. It's nice to now have at least one place worth recommending.

A2I0LK_hzTIOmPLxpUVmnA.text: A small Lebanese restaurant with great food! Although the place is not upscale, the food was really good. It's location near the station proved to be really helpful after a long air trip and subsequent train journey.

OtKBHXwojQ29HAOlZ2T6sw.text: Had some hummus and salad followed by a mixed grill. Yummy stuff very fresh. Juices are nice good place for chill and detox.

h5DXNJTDXLE5d0HHrZ1Z7g.text: I've heard great things about this spot, so maybe my expectations were high, but I was a little disappointed.  I ordered the chicken shawarma, and it was a bit dry.  Granted, that's the only thing I tried, so I can't speak to any of the other dishes; service is quick and no-nonsense.

JbkdsXA2wMHG355-_s6jfQ.text: I've become slightly addicted to this place after a friend introduced it to me a few weeks ago. There are so many Lebanese restaurants in the Paddington area but I'm quite glad this clean, tasty and cheap option is right around the corner.  I'd eventually like to work my way through all the vegetarian options on the menu, but so far I keep getting the same few things due to cravings! Highly recommend the "Special" tea (green tea, mint, rose water, and a cinnamon stick) to go along with your meal - it's quite delicious!If you're new to Lebanese cuisine, I imagine this would be a great place to experiment with what you like before you dive into the establishments on nearby Edgware Road.

tMSXDZUH2rVc9zkZvvrzAQ.text: Ditto Bruce K - I owe Yelp this discovery. Having cycled past it countless times to and from Paddington, I finally got to sample the wares here thanks to the reviews here via the Yelp app, and very glad I was too.From the outside, it's not much to look at, resembling a standard takeaway, which is probably why I never gave it a second thought. But the service, welcome and quality of food changed everything. Particular highlights were the juicy yet crunchy tabbouleh, the heavenly baba ghanouj and the de-lish apple and ginger juice. And all really cheap too: mezzes are around the £4 mark, and drinks just shy of £2.Needless to say, I can definitely seeing myself stopping here in the future to get my food fix before heading westwards on the train.

V7CE9u5oNYOL0vAAgJ8DnA.text: I ordered a shish tawouk and it was burned and the fattosh wasn't fresh and auful. I don't recommend this restaurant to anyone.

_In_D3y7gXYtDoaZEZkkWg.text: There are so many places to choose from near Paddington station in London, but after going to two other pubs closer to Hyde park and not finding one that could seat our group of 5, and an Indian restaurant where nothing no the menu was less than £15 per person, we walked by the Ya Hala and looked in.  It was very busy, but when we asked the apparent owner if there was seating available for 5, a set of two tables appeared almost magically and we were promptly seated.  He was very enthusiastic and obviously proud of his restaurant as he explained their fixed menu special for £10 per person, which is basically a typical Lebanese family dinner.  He then offered us complementary samples of their house made beverage, which is a minty drink made with apples, ginger and fresh mint.  We were hooked.  We ordered 4 of the family dinner specials, which could be had with either rice or couscous.  The last of us ordered fried halloumi cheese and a mixed shawarma wrap.  The main entree was a well seasoned grilled boneless chicken served with two vegetable dishes including chick peas, egg plant, onions and spices.  We were all quite full when the proprietor returned and placed small cubes of their homemade baklava, which were a perfect end to an wonderful meal.  Best of all, we felt appreciated and well cared for.  In our 3 weeks in the UK, this was our most memorable dining experience and an excellent value.

QtykHg_qoCT6HnggnnibzA.text: Really good Lebanese food. Went there for lunch a few times. The chicken shawarma is great.

-gywBdKNSZuRn6K7_ZaoFA.text: One of those places you're forever grateful for stumbling upon. We came here after going to see The Drowned Man; had the baby BBQ chicken and just had to come back today - two days later - to have it again. Very delicious food with excellent service.

QnCpNaUMa-6VSovMXwQxXQ.text: Average fare. Friendly service. Decent prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom

9OVL8Lmi13FkIcwDAmIRWw.text: Great food.  You can tell they are serious about delivering really great food, and making sure you are happy.  Very good for vegetarians.  I had the combo vegetarian starter (hummus, lentils, roasted cauliflower, roasted potatoes, roasted red pepper) and the combo swarma (chicken and lamb).  It was very nicely done, and really good. I ate it in my hotel room, and think they could have used more seasoning (i.e, salt) but that's probably for the better... if you want more add it (I didnt have access to a salt shaker).  This place is a no-brainer for vegetarians.  Hummus is incredible ... creamy, rich, perfectly seasoned.  I also had the kibbeh (I think it is called ... like a kind of fritter with ground meat inside ... very good).

hZ5JykD5A9qsZuWsFAuM8A.text: Yum! This place is great! I was staying around the corner, and stopped by one evening to grab a quick dinner to go. The staff was courteous, solicitous, and extremely gracious. My meal was prepared fresh and was ready to take away in just five minutes. And it was DELICIOUS. So good! For what you get, the price is extremely reasonable. I'll be back the next time I'm in town!

IJwBVXHpV93H46sE_ZX7Lw.text: Friendly & efficient staff. Enjoyed the grape leaves, lamb, and couscous. Close to Paddington Station, so our 8 year old got a photo with the bear statue on a full belly.

qlbPUZN-YrjKcQvh8E56RQ.text: Food was ready very quickly, and is delicious. The staff is amazing and friendly as well. They were very hospitable

RCclkV4jCNai3d_6bvgkcQ.text: Loved this place! By far the best place to eat around Paddington. Their Halloumi Grilled Cheese is out of this world!!! Must go if you're around. Very nice and cozy, definitively surpassed my expectations.

buLBv_VS_N1dNmEYpAW1oA.text: I've eaten here a few times. It's just off Praed street and an easy place to step to from Paddington station. I've had the felafel a couple times and the vine leaves and both are just great. The service has always been quick enough, even during the lunch rush.Frankly, the place doesn't look like much. You could easily walk by and not realise there's good Lebanese food here. I recommend getting the starters with a main. In some restaurants I get just the main, but here the mains are not quite big enough to satisfy on their own. I think getting a starter first complements the food and makes it a bit more satisfying.

4PH2q07VpaSSnGzsacJnpw.text: Sat down for 10 minutes waiting for the waitress, no issues as the place was busy. While waiting i couldn't help but notice that the tall guy by the cashierbwas a bit too involved, so here are the chain of events I witnessed:Used the cashier machine, shook some guys hand, handled some takeway bags, wiped his hands on his shirt, wiped his face, beard and NOSE with his hands (2 times) then proceeded to handle pita bread with his hands, some meant for the "big to go order" and possibly for the in restaurant diners. At this point i got up and started to leave. I was then approached by the waitress inquiring if everything was ok, when I responded with the above she gave me a bad look.Ill leave it up to you to decide but i would think such non sanitary handling of food justifies skipping the place.

TcPlJbuTyJxjVgFmf9lCUA.text: eaten here about 6 times and its a destination stop for me around Paddington. Cheap. Fresh. Delicious. Have anything here especially the daily specials and the wait staff are quite entertaining to observe...they all speak about 3 sentences of any language too. Sit in the back and look at the funky tiles in the mirror..sort of an Escherque experience. The tea is elixir that somehow makes my feet even not throb and at the end of your meal they give you a small piece of Baklava which in and of itself is worth the visit...if you like Lebanese food do not miss this little place!

t-HQUP03bH9MIzZ7ezBgPw.text: I really enjoyed getting a bite to eat here after a long day of walking around the city. The staff are as friendly as they come, and the restaurant has a casual atmosphere with lots of fun drawings on the walls. This was my first time eating Lebanese, so I tried one of the specials recommended by the waiter that was a lamb and spinach dish. It was delicious and very filling. Their house apple, ginger, and mint juice was so yummy and I find myself craving it months later! They also give you a tiny piece of baklava at the end of your meal, which was an unexpected treat. Next time I am in London, I will definitely make another stop here.

Wn_eCbpuw41t6GuEq_dtrA.text: Good value.FOOD:  3.5. I had the Mixed Shawarma with couscous, and it was very filling.  The sliced lamb hit the spot, and the condiments enhanced the taste.  I would order it again!I also tried the Lamb Sambousek mezze as it looked interesting.  Glad I tried it, but won't order it again.SERVICE: 3.5.  AMBIENCE: 2.5.  Fast-food atmosphere.  TIP:  avoid the table next to the door unless you want a blast of (in Mar) cold air every time someone enters or leaves.

_ESwB4qCInRtleyg7D2t_w.text: We were staying near Paddington Station and stumbled on Ya Hala as we walked from the Tube station to our hotel, at 10pm after a long day of sight seeing. We were tired, hungry and thankful they were open. The staff greeted us with big, cheerful smiles. The food was fresh and delicious. And they were kind. On our way out we grabbed a bottle of water but we didn't have any British pounds on us. We offered to pay by credit card but they just gave us the bottle. The next day we went back for lunch and offered to pay for the water and they kindly refused payment, saying it was their pleasure.

IRwMPQgzjyIvKzLtkE2imw.text: What for a great food experience !Nice, helpful and funny waitress.The meals are very tasty and great.I defenitly can recommend this location

Pngt5bAMs50o05zCu3SXfg.text: I used to live close to this place and have loved getting their spreads, ie tabouleh, hummus etc... especially bc time and time again they give you complimentary mini baklava bites which are heavenly.I typically get the wraps... and what I have found out unfortunately is that what the board SAYS is in the wrap is not what actually is in there. and this has happened at least 6 times.  The wrap I typically get is the halloumi wrap and there apparently are a number of roasted veg etc... but you actually find a pickle and courgette... that's it... this has happened a few times.  I initially did not notice as I would always take it to go and by the time I would eat I would not put two and two together. however, once I asked them to ensure that what's on the table will go in the wrap. I got confirmation and once I opened it.. it was the same usual crap.So .... sorry I cannot give them more than 3*. even this is only due to the complimentary baklava. I sure hope that mine is just a one-off.

kpeQDHtZgCRlfKwA7MXBIA.text: I liked it a lot! Friendly service, good, healty food, and a lot of options! Great healty alternative for the fastfood chains around the corner!

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Falafal menu

Blx-gO3sSfBScpficbypIA.text: We read all the recent reviews and tried Ya Hala for dinner this past week, and we're glad we did!  I ordered the special, a chicken dish, and it was absolutely delicious.  It's a very casual place, quite near the Paddington station.  We shared table space with others familiar with the area who had obviously eaten there before.  We chatted with them as well as the staff, and had a wonderful time for a very low cost - just under 13 GBP or 20 USD.

cjYgSOaB2SMTbMTMHTFoQw.text: Food is fine, but the service was really not up to standard. I waited a good 25 mins for my order, which only takes 5 mins to prepare, not because it was busy at the restaurant, but for unknown reason, my order was forgotten... Then when paying the bill, they again kept me waiting for quite a while.. Not gonna come back...

Q3q1vxrvzy61iTm4ZuMBxw.text: Best falafel ever. Made fresh to order, no prefried here!And that smooth, creamy hummus will be on my mind for days. It was the kind of meal that when you've finished you get sad. Sad because you couldn't possibly fit anything else in and you want to eat it again; and sad because it's a million miles from home you won't get to eat here again for a while. Go. Eat everything.

jxRUJ91l57kURjx_soiYWw.text: I used to treat myself to coming here on my lunch break back when I worked in nearby Sheldon Square; it was always busy then, and when I returned with a friend last night, it was even busier. Our 2 minute wait for a table to become available, was barely noticed due to the friendly staff explaining specials and getting us menus. The menu is full of typical middle eastern fare to suit any taste. We chose to start with some deliciously smooth homemade hummus, and fresh flat bread. This was followed up by a whole roasted baby chicken and my friend a lamb shawarma.The place didn't quieten down the whole time we were there, with people coming to sit down as well as queue up for take away. This small place has an easy atmosphere about it; between the close knit tables glances and comments were shared about how good everything is. For us, it was the perfect extension to a few pints in the pub, and with it's close proximity to Paddington, it could serve as the ideal destination for something a bit different to munch on the last train home!

0RA2H1LrcKjNlNIayYN9Qg.text: Ambiance is pretty plain but it is a good place for a quick bite.Decent sized portions, quick service and tasty food.

tjBwte3QOsuTez7XVfVYyw.text: Found this place randomly when looking for a Persian restaurant (which was closed), but Lebanese and Persian are practically the same thing. This place was quite busy the night I went. Its like all other kebab take away shops, but with a table service eating area.The food is reasonably price, the menu is choc-a-block full of delicious options and the service was friendly and efficient.    I was quite surprised at how amazing the food was. It was extremely delicious, and very generous in portions. I would highly recommend the apple and ginger fruit juice.

ImwzDzAm9fEzC7Y7N81EdA.text: The fish is vey fresh and the lamb is so delicious. The plate is big and well worth the money. The whole family enjoy the food.

g_0eenHnfzy4yyZ0nmOD1Q.text: "Sir, the wifi works but we don't allow customers to use it..." I don't want to judge a restaurant for its WiFi connection but it says something... Food ok, for a fast food restaurant.

XAB7zIQSGKRXWQwjXxGYVg.text: Looking for an authentic place to eat Mediterranean food late night in London?  The place looked very promising with a great location close to Paddington Station and quite a bit of customers inside but was disappointed.  The food lacked flavor and spice which is predominate in Mediterranean cuisine.  The grilled meats were a bit stale and overcooked so I had a tough time eating it.  The rice and grilled veggies were just okay and edible with nothing to get you excited about.  However the customer service was good and the waiters attentive and caring.  That made our dinner a decent one at Ya Hala.

09mVC9P0RJD17Td81XrPIA.text: Not just  another  kebab shop!. Ya Hala is conveniently  located less  than  20m from paddington underground on London  Street.  For lunch great  specials and get in early for dinner. Try the special  tea, homamade lemonade and zingy ginger and apple tea. Loved the koftes and the  kibeh was amazing.

Z-66vwwSDgR0Yms0dtvKWA.text: I came here based on good Yelp reviews.  I decided to take food back to the hotel.  While I was waiting, I observed the staff working the open kitchen.  Everyone was efficient and friendly.  The food was delicious and the price is great for the amount and quality of food you get.

njFcatH4vg-TjQBJEvqywA.text: Great quick food across the street from Paddington. The wraps are inexpensive and delicious. We ordered one wrap and the vegetarian mezze, a platter of 6 delicious starters plus a salad, which was just enough for two. The place is quite chaotic and fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Special deals menu
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Menu

yrXPXsvUpCxG3G0j15iZRQ.text: Really good Lebanese food! Friendly stuff and good lunch sets served really quickly! I can recommend the falafel :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom

yioMK7t5krN7nQmiSTMpkA.text: Special food and really nice people.  Right next to Paddington.  Fast service and awesome food made right in front of you.

LIGhscV5L_C8-RnzCkcfnQ.text: Good quick food. But could be better for it's prices. But not bad for a fast casual. It's a small place if you go in the peak hours expect to wait for a little bit. May not be a good place for a big group if you all want to sit tother. Decent food and good service over all.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom

7HEbSJUpKrd1UlfEI8r3Zw.text: We ordered several different items, vegetarian and meaty, EVERYTHING was amazing!  We are staying down the block and will definitely be back before we leave.

t1PsDKUshTemc5npAs648A.text: We're visiting from America - and although we love Great Britain.. the food here is not the best. EXCEPT THIS PLACE! It's sooo good! Most definitely the BEST food near Paddington station. And probably the best food we have had in London in general. We came here 2 nights in a row. We ordered the hummus with naan bread, grilled chicken with salad and couscous, mixed grill with sliced lamb, minced lamb, and chicken the first night and it was cooked perfectly. The next night we had chicken shawarma, which is also sooo good. We also had their special tea both nights. I highly recommend this place. It's kind of crowded and usually very busy - even on a week night. But it's because the food is sooo good. If we lived here we would be regulars. 5 stars to Ya Hala!

pjdC04YYmnLWxfTHEkKIvg.text: I'm in London for a few weeks for business and Ya Hala has become my go to spot to pick up lunch or dinner. The restaurant is cute and interesting.  They have some fun caricatures of movie characters up basically telling you to ear there and they're all fun to check out. The lamb shwarma has become my favorite and at only £3.50 it's an easy item to keep going back for.

koiiKh5nuuf5qXElWoulmw.text: Thoroughly excellent food. I went for halloumi starter and lamb kebab with Lebanese couscous, freshly prepared, fast service. 2 course and a drink for 1 comes in at about £20.

oPb5pSRFEcILdlXZB8bvpg.text: Good food, poor service! Fire alarm kept on going off and grinding noises from basement made this experience quite bad. When our guests had not arrived 10 past our booking we were asked:are they coming???? Nah won't be back!

XlTTSLXp1DHaD3Yz6-gZAw.text: I've said before and I'll say it again, I eat at lots of places both in the main stream and out of the way, and I generally won't be bothered to review average food. So take this as my whole hearted endorsement of exceptional with a review on yelp...I'm not from London I Went there this evening at the recommendation of a friend and colleague whom I was meeting while traveling in London on business this week. I was looking forward to the idea of Lebanese all day since it was suggested yesterday. And I must say that I was rather delighted! The food was so well prepared and all fresh  and fantastic. Walking in from the street I was bombarded with scents and smells that made my mouth instantly water. The very best baba ghanouj I have ever had! And their apple ginger mint drink was so delicious! My friend and I shared 4 mezze dishes and a lentil rice salad and it was all fantastic! There was nothing left and with the tip was 27 quid..that is an outstanding value for how well prepared the food was and that we got 5 dishes..Nice family, super friendly and the little dessert baklava were a little taste of sweet heaven! Thank you Matthew Parker for the recommendation and the food was so so good!

PEwQr4u8paHeq_6gQSQM9w.text: I live in Worthing, and this little place is often on my mind for a good reason to visit London. I love the food and it's close to the Paddington Station. The service is a little on the slow side, and not terribly personal, but the food more than makes up for it. Try the homemade ginger drink if you're feeling adventurous - it won't disappoint! The kafta sandwich is great, the shawarma also awesome. The spicy hummus is fantastic, and the tabbouli is definitely legit. I cannot say enough good things about the food at this place - it's very authentic. I cannot wait to go back again and keep tackling that menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Tabbouli and hummus! Yay.

9zVpkjWoy3KVW1TtAbQBqg.text: Love this place!! Very yummy, suuuuuper friendly staff, and very good prices for lunch. Before my office location changed I would come here about once a week!The chicken shawarma wrap is my favorite. Good hummous too!

EC_6G2CTkiwpaT8MbVlv0w.text: We saw the chef take the lamb cubes and rice from a table they just collected from, placed it in a bowl and put it in the microwave. They then put it on a new plate with salad and served it to our table. It was very dry lamb when we cut it and who know how may times it had been re-heated"!This was very disappointing. Never going back.

dcxkKVVhLUBP03s95tgENQ.text: I went on my first night in to London while my wife was sleeping off jet lag. I saw the long line and ordered food to take back to the hotel. Got a special #2 and the chicken gyro from the spit. Lebanese was slightly different than typical Mediterranean food but it was better. The pita bread was more of a crepe and it was excellent. Would definitely come back.

Irj-mCw5EXYif19GYX4JOQ.text: Ordered chicken wings and they came more burnt than I've seen any food served at a restaurant. Would not come back

VIXz9tyq85OvDxkzSJN4pQ.text: Everyone who lives and works in the area knows ya hala. It is a local secret with amazing quality home made Lebanese food at affordable prices.

w8-nfBvbSabHiMkPGiBTIg.text: I love it when Yelp brings me to new places and new flavors and new experiences. I can't say that I've ever had "Lebanese" food before so when I was in the Paddington area but not quite ready to take my train back to Reading, I let Yelp do the searching and the suggesting. And now I have a favorite place to get a meal before getting a train!Clean and welcoming, I looked over the menu and went with a hummus starter and the Lamb Shawarma (with cous cous instead of rice). No beer of course, so I had a bottle of sparkling water instead.The food arrived almost immediately. The hummus presented nicely in a bowl with another bowl of cut up pita breads for scooping. A moment later, the lamb. A generous portion with a nice salad and a good pile of cous cous. Delicious and moist, I completely cleaned my plate. I would have picked it up and licked it if I didn't want to be thrown out. Since I was so appreciative, they gave me a free bit of baklava for the ride. (Not the usual triangle - it was rolled. Strange but good!)A fab deal for a decent price. I was stuffed and ready for the train back to Reading. I will absolutely return!It's just across the street from the station, so there aren't any excuses.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Lamb shawarma
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Kitchen and cooking area
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Hummus and pitas

I2dQ-VXTs4HffLuqYkk_3A.text: My parents and I visited London at the end of September and stayed near Paddington station.  We randomly walked into this restaurant one night and were suprised (no - floored, really) at how delicious and fresh everything was!  The hummus was fantastic - must have been made with fresh chickpeas.  The fatoush salad had a dressing made with crushed pomegranates and had a sweet, tangy taste that was fantastic.  You will see from the pics that we had a bit of everything: sea bass, chicken, veg plate - all delish.  They even brought out complimentary cashew baklava for us at the end of the meal!  Great service, wonderful food.  If I could give it more stars, I would.  Thank you Ya Hala/Paramount Kitchen!

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom

qjgCBvBfhmow404rcEt0zQ.text: Ya Hala is very conveniently located in Paddington.  My sister and I were walking around and wanted to find an early dinner because we had flights out the next day.  We saw the good reviews and decided to give Ya Hala a try.  When we walked in we were immediately greeted and seated.We were given a few minutes to look over the menu and just asked for some tap water which we were happy came with ice.  We ordered the lamb kofta and the lamb shawarma plate both with rice.While we were sitting we were close to the prep area where we could watch dishes being prepared. I watched for a little bit as they put plates together.  They put one plate together that was supposed to be lamb shawarma (mine) but put chicken on it too.  It sat up there for a little bit and when the waitress saw, told them it was wrong.  So after a few minutes they took off the chicken, let it sit a little longer and then added some warm lamb on top of the lamb already there.  It was about 10 minutes time from the time it was first put up until they brought our meals.  By the time it got to me, the lab was really cold dry.  It was not enjoyable and had no flavor.  The rice was also very dry and flavorless.  We drank our water and never got a refill and the waitress never came back to ask how anything was so we couldn't even say that the food was cold.  I don't think I would ever return to Ya Hala if I were in the area and it would never be my first pick.  It was mediocre at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Lamb shawarma plate with rice

pHBjXKsvyZKqWwYF2puVvw.text: Oh my God best falafel in the world.Hummus amazingChicken kabob was awesome!Lamb kabob wasn't very goodCute placeReasonable prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom

HbEmxlKVkd4ZvPQIf7RyVg.text: Good Lebanese food is one of the things I miss the most about London after moving back to the states.  I first stumbled upon Ya Hala when I was catching a train at Paddington and needed something quick to eat.  It's a pretty no-frills place, but I noticed a lot of regulars coming in for sit down meals and thought it was strange because large transportation hubs are typically surrounded by dismal food options. You could say my expectations were nonexistent.I only tried some of their mezze during that particular visit but it was fresh and tasty.  Fast forward a few months later and I discovered that my flat was actually within their delivery zone on Deliveroo and subsequently my fondness for Ya Hala dinner nights blossomed.  Everything we've tried has been delicious but standouts are the crispy falafel balls, lamb kebabs, and grilled baby chicken.  The tuom and spicy sauce are the perfect condiments and if you request more they are super generous about it.Will definitely be back whenever I'm in town!

URQZqmy2lWm5Y2Qb0tPP-w.text: The food is great, the service is not. You have to flag your server down to get them to come over to you but that didn't stop us from going twice during our 1 week vacation since we liked the food so much. It's a great place for vegetarians. The hummus, falafel & cous cous are all good and the baklava is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian special (chefs choice of 6 veg entres)
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Falafel plate

ZSaCU5tCbw6yr8rtf9yoWw.text: It's been acquired by Paramount, a global middle eastern chain, and the food doesn't taste the same anymore. No more lamb shawarmas. :( even the spicy sauce that comes with the garlic sauce is different. Miss you ya hala

SmyQfTk6Iv2DYKxG0GF-4A.text: If you find yourself in London near Paddington Train Station AND you like Middle Eastern cuisine, do yourself a favor and drop into this Lebanese place and order the mixed platter where the chef selects the dishes. Also order the fried halloumi cheese, the baba ganoush, and some hummus and pita. Accompany all that fresh goodness with a house drink (they will let you sample if you're not sure) and enjoy. You won't be sorry. Get there early if you want tabouli!Don't let the one surly waiter discourage you. Think 'soup nazi' and you'll be fine ...if you have a sense of humor. He even looks like the soup nazi. I'd put up with a sourpuss any day to eat this good food. I've eaten here four times; once in 2015 and three times this past May. The food quality has always been lively and fresh and delicious. They have another place in Brixton as well. Hands down, this is my favorite restaurant in London. It's equal in NYC is Hummus Kitchen (3 NYC locations). How lucky am I/are we to have both!)Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Heaven awaits at London's Ya Hala!

619mBkgGT-6ctIOwQYy_1g.text: This was one of the best placed we ate at the entire visit in London and some of the best Lebanese food I've had. It's located right near the Paddington station. We were able to get a seat without a wait, but it does get very busy. They seem to also do a pretty big takeout business. The food was so good. The hummus was lamb shawarma was delicious. Very smooth hummus and the lamb was really tender. I've never seen lamb shawarma and it did not disappoint. The mixed grill was great. Each kabob was flavorful and tender. The rice and salad that accompanied it was fresh. I was really impressed with the price points. I felt you got a real value for your money.Service was adequate. The wait staff takes your orders in a timely manner and delivers the food when it's ready. Overall a really great place and definitely worth the trip if you are craving Lebanese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Hummus & Lamb Shawarma
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Mixed Grill - Lamb, chicken & ground beef kabob.

vKEXOaOvajqmMIUCfL3mDg.text: This tiny Lebanese diner/takeout counter offers up a big selection of tasty Levantine cuisine for cheap. With only a half dozen tables, many people seem to carry out; even at 9pm on a Friday night, the waitstaff seemed overwhelmed. While service was on the slow side, the food was worth the wait. I went with the special mezze plate: chef's selection of mezze with couscous, salad, and pita. That plate had small portions of hummus, lentils and rice, stuffed grape leaves, okra in tomato sauce, green beans, spicy potato, and thin lamb sausage. Everything on the plate was satisfying, all the better when paired with their house mint tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Special mixed mezze plate. The selections might change, but everything on there was great

_lBV56SFx-ZBa4CLTSnqjg.text: I had the lamb chops which were very tasty and with a generous quantity of sides (couscous and salad).The restaurant is clean, prices are good and the service it is OK.Definitely the best Lebanese I had in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom

zO6T8HLgOLVtrDjyxez3Hw.text: Came here twice for my late night dinner. Pretty good and inexpensive foods. 4 pounds for a wrap which was a pretty darn good deal. Delicious foods.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom

SCpC8XV-PlOmsqQwR9MgUA.text: Ya Hala is hands down THE Best Place to eat in close proximity to Paddington station.Amazingly tasty Lebanese food served in a clean hygienic environment with friendly service.We keep going back here when craving a bit of comforting Middle Eastern food, when I'm too tired to come home and cook or just in the mood for shawarma.While their food does taste good even when brought home, its best if you can eat it on location as the eish / pita bread is so much softer and tastier when brought hot out of the ovens.The hummus beiruty is a spiced up version of the hummus if you crave an extra tingle in your bite. I love the chicken wings (but be warned, they take a little longer to prepare) and the sauce with the soujuk (sausages) is amazing to mop up with the bread.The shawarmas are my favourite, for kebabs I prefer Indian/Pakistani super spiced versions but they do have a decent selection of well cooked meat.Honestly, Id be happy with just the starters and bread though, all tied up with a pot of their amazing tea which has hints of mint and rose and cinnamon.Very reasonable prices. Friendly service and oh, they also have washrooms downstairs. Definitely look at the cartoons on the walls, they have all been drawn for the location itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Wings
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Special tea and hummus
Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Chicken wings

FS_M0qaDlVoA4AVsTnawug.text: Overall, I enjoyed the food. Following the suggestions of another Yelp person, I preserved the following:1) Appetizer:  Mouta belle - damn good; humus - ok, but not great. 2) Drink: Ginger, mint, apple juice.  It is very good. 3) : The menu says it's for 1, but you enough food for 2 ... and it's damn good as well. Mixed Mezze .  So much food that the 2nd order Lamb schwemma (spelling ?) had to be taken back to the hotel.  As with a few other Yelp listings!be leery of the directions.  They're off by a little bit.

9znT4AmdNO0JxTm9FUUb8A.text: Came here twice on our trip to London and the food was amazing both the times. We had falafel with rice entree and my friend had a chicken shawarma and she couldn't stop talking about how good it was the whole trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom. Special entree with Falafal and rice

Qi5wDRgLhjWfpaK1RDCHAw.text: I dropped off some luggage for the Heathrow Express and went to Ya Hala due to the great reviews online.  Turned out if anything the reviews understated how good Ya Hala is, probably the highlight of my trip.Started with the grilled halloumi cheese.  It was good, nice and well seasoned (led by salt), sizable portion.As everything looked good, I went with the mezze sampler.  Really loved the two kinds of meat (chicken and lamb shwarma), both were tender, marinated and tasty.  All the mezze were also good.  Loved the hummus, again good flavors.  Very nice eggplant and okra dishes.  Several other dishes (i think about six in total), all very good.  Wasn't crazy about the potato, a little too spicy.Overall, great meal and rather than going just because it is near Paddington, it is now a destination unto itself.

suG5Lnf8QFhUyjNxf6hMfg.text: I had a very lovely late night dinner here with my Dad. The staff was very kind and helpful with suggestions and attentive to us. The lamb was great and I loved the couscous and Pita:) The charcoal chicken was a little dry for my liking but the sauce they provided helped that minor issue. Definitely great for a late night snack and have excellent deserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Ya Hala - London, United Kingdom

3xVT7KemRlPz83miJUZM9w.text: This place is absolutely amazing. It's small and always busy but it's worth the wait to get seats. We went twice while visiting London. Waited one night for about 10 minutes. Second night we walked in at perfect timing for a table. They also do take away. The hummus is to die for. Not typical American but smoother, richer and more flavorful. The falafel is also perfectly seasoned and crispy. One night I tried the mixed schwarma and both the chicken and the lamb were tender and perfectly seasoned. The Lebanese couscous is impeccable. Their "special tea" is the only thing to get for grown ups and older children will also likely enjoy a small glass. Second night I had the "weekday special" they make lamb or chicken Lebanese style and only serve it on weekdays. Get it if you go M-F. Prices are so reasonable and the service is great. As a bonus,Alex, one of the staff loves Americans!

-ZeJDqR5DR3lJfXK45l5Eg.text: Love this place.  Prices are very good and you get a lot of food. We did the veggie platter and it had a lot of flavor.  The staff was nice

KJRNusXqNlZzzG_fTDCF1A.text: Visited in September 2017.  Fantastic food, friendly staff.  I had been craving good Levantine cuisine since my visit in 2006, and was finally satisfied by Ya Hala.  This is a small place and there was a long wait; the staff looked out for us and made sure we got a seat.  One of the highlights of our stopover in London.

fifAldWD3bWsVDe9sc706w.text: We "discovered" this restaurant by ourselves without the help of Yelp! We just WALKED in.   We needed a table for four to celebrate my 47th wedding anniversary.   Seeing only small tables for two and a large one with a reserved sign,  the waitress to our pleasant surprise simply removed it and seated us in the best table of the house.  That first welcoming impression was followed by both the familiar menu Mediterranean dishes and the new.  I loved their lentil soup and my fellow diners were  captivated by their lamb chops.  I was smitten by the soup and told the waitress how I felt. She claimed that they had the best Lebanese chef. I wanted to return again but had to try lentil soup at another restaurant for comparison.  My informal taste test only confirmed her claim.What brought us back for three dinners out of four were the two waitresses who were attentive and personal.  On the day after dining there,  when we were walking by, the waitress waved to us in friendly recognition.While they were busy, they were able to satisfy my curiosity about their food, their home country, and were able to share about our mutual immigrant experiences.  As we are now about to set sail on a 15 day cruise from South Hampton, via Iceland to New York which will be replete with many types of cuisine, I nonetheless am experiencing a sense of loss. When I return home to the San Francisco Bay Area which is a foodie haven, I will still longingly recall this dining memory on London Street.
